page.title: 01TRANSPORT AROUND ROTHWELL
page.content: The whole area is bounded on the west side by the major motorway network in the north of England. At Lofthouse there is the M1/M62 interchange on which an average, is used by 1370 vehicles per hour. The Lofthouse interchange is built on three levels, the lower level being the north/south M1 from Leeds to London, the intermediate level is the east/west M62 from Hull to Manchester. The busiest motorway is the westbound M62 towards Manchester. Following a mid-morning survey it was found that approximatley 1215 vehicles per hour used this motorway at its Lofthouse point, most vehicles being heavy goods.In the past the area was criss-crossed with thriving railway lines, these have been dismantled. Theses lines were the transportation system for local pits and brickworks.
